body.raw:
create rule gps
using  post_body = { notificationType = 'gps'
                   , deviceId = header.deviceId
                   , data =
                       { latitude = body.pidData?.GpsReading?.latitude?
                       , longitude = body.pidData?.GpsReading?.longitude?
                       }
                   , header = body.pidData?.GpsReading?.gps?.heading?
                   }
,      bin_id = '127dw6f1'
where  eq(body.type, 'TripData')
with   post(uri=s'http://requestb.in/${bindings.bin_id}', body= json(bindings.post_body))
create rule AllEvents using my_map = { body = body, header = header } where true with amqp(body = json(bindings.my_map))

create rule DynamoDB
using itemBody = { body = body, header = header }
where true
with Destination(
  item = json(bindings.itemBody),
  destinationId = '8b6a45a7-fdd5-4b54-a259-3b6955d1766c'
)
create rule AllEvents using my_map = { body = body, header = header } where true with amqp(body = json(bindings.my_map), exchange='x-hash', key=header.deviceId)

3. In the body , pass the device id and payload as device data.

1. This API is front end  API.
2. It is used  to view  details about an individual tag  in a particular tenant.
3. Pass valid tenant id in environment variable- tenantId
4. Pass valid tagid in the value of Path valrible to execute this API.

1. It is fron end API.
2. It is used to disabled any enabled   device in a particuar tenant.
3. Pass the valid tenant id in the environment varaible.
4. In the Body, pass enabled as false to enbale the device.
5. Pass the device id (to disable ) in the path variable value.

response.name: List Folders| With 200 OK

request.description:
1. It is backend API.
2. It is used to remove a configuration folder from your system. Any files inside the folder will also be deleted when you delete a folder. Deleting a folder that is assigned to devices is prohibited.
3. Pass the valid tennat id in the environment varaible.
4. Pass the Config folder name which need to delete in th path varaible value

item.name: Folder Ops - Firmware
item.description:
The platform allows users to control firmware updates through a folder system.
There are two types of foldersfirmware and configurationwhich hold files of the matching type. Folders (not files) are assigned to individual devices, one of each kind of folder maximum.

Each folder can have one and only one of its contained files marked as 'active.' Every time the device connects to the server, the system compares the name of the firmware file that the device reports to the name of the active files in the device's assigned folder. If there is a mismatch, the device will be told to update to the active file.

With this system, many devices can be updated with a single change in the selection of the active file.

Use these methods to upload and manage firmware files and folders.
